pages.text: Rolfosteus is a genus of camuropiscid placoderm from the Late Devonian of Australia. Having a skull length of 11 centimeters (4.3 inches),  the animal was quite unusual for placoderms, having an elongated rostrum, similar to those of billfish, that would make the fast-swimming predator hydrodynamic. This new hydrodynamicism would allow this predator even more speed to catch up with its fast swimming prey.
